approve.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to officially accept a plan, proposal etc
approve.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The conference approved a proposal for a referendum.
approve.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to think that someone or something is good, right, or suitable
approve.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Catherine’s parents now approve of her marriage.
I don’t approve of cosmetic surgery.
approve.translation[0].note_box[0].items: You use approve of when saying that someone thinks that someone or something is good or right
Her parents didn’t approve of her boyfriend
Her parents didn’t approve her boyfriend
You use approve when saying that a person or group of people officially agrees to allow something to happen
approve.translation[0].note_box[1].secti: to officially accept a plan, proposal etc
The Medical Research Council has approved the use of a new drug for breast cancer.
to approve a law or proposal, especially by voting
Many anti-smoking laws have been passed.
to make a written agreement official by signing it
The treaty was ratified by the Senate in 1988.
to approve something without really thinking about it – used to show disapproval
Parliament merely rubber-stamped the president’s decisions.
